DataElement.preferredName: Anal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for anal carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the anal canal or anal margin.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include squamous papilloma and papillary hidradenoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and melanoma._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the anal canal or anal margin.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include squamous papilloma and papillary hidradenoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and melanoma.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the anal canal or anal margin.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include squamous papilloma and papillary hidradenoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/11/18 released by tt. 2/22/18 tt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Anal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of anal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to all carcinomas arising in the anal canal, including carcinomas that arise within anorectal fistulas and those arising in the perianal area (anal margin). High-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas (small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma) are staged using this system. There is no AJCC staging system for anal mucosal melanomas and anal well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.__One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
